10:11 <Evi\_> Hey guys, is there any way in "xwiki security" to configure that after a "third failed log-in attempt" the user gets blocked? To reduces the chance of an attacker access.  
10:12 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
10:32 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
10:44 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:46 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
10:47 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:19 <acotiuga> has quit  
11:54 <lkrejci> has quit  
11:59 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:59 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
12:34 <martinus\_\_> M-cjd, are you around ?  
12:35 <ClemensR> revapi-check  fails on me when trying to build xwiki-platform-test-ui : "java.class.removed: class org.xwiki.test.ui.po.CopyStatusPage: Class was removed."  I guess it is only me, as jenkins is still happy ?  
12:36 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
12:59 <lkrejci> has quit  
12:59 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
13:09 <Evi\_> According to https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/How+can+I+change+the+Session+timeout I'm wondering what exactly means "session time out". Has it something to do with automatically logout after 30 min no user-interaction with the system?  
13:30 <ClemensR> yes, that is the usual session timeout from the container; XWiki does not change that  
13:43 <tmortagne> ClemensR: re revapi you are not the only one it seems  
13:44 <ClemensR> ah, ok. some comfort ;)  though it is abit distracting to have this on BFD  
14:17 <Evi\_> Thx, for your answer, ClemensR. I'm testing it and it seems that I'm still logged in, after 30 min doing nothing in the system..  
14:20 <ClemensR> ah, ok. I am trying to remember if session timeout actually means logout ... I remember XWiki uses some framework to keep authentication information that does not depend on sessions  
14:34 <tmortagne> XWiki remember the credentials in the cookie  
14:35 <tmortagne> (so that you are automatically authenticated when you come back)
